meanings.definition: Originating from a different individual or species.
meanings.sent1: The zoo introduced an allogenic monkey to the group.
meanings.sent2: The allogenic flowers in the garden added variety to the landscape.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see an allogenic bird teaching the local birds a new song.
meanings.sent4: The allogenic ideas brought by the new team member sparked creativity in the project.
meanings.sent5: The allogenic colors of the sunset painted the sky in a mesmerizing display.

meanings.definition: Relating to a transplant of tissue or cells from a donor to a recipient.
meanings.sent1: The hospital performed an allogenic kidney transplant successfully.
meanings.sent2: The allogenic blood donation saved the patient's life.
meanings.sent3: The allogenic organ transplant turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The allogenic bone marrow transplant gave the patient a new lease on life.
meanings.sent5: The allogenic skin graft helped the burn victim heal faster.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a substance derived from a different source.
meanings.sent1: The allogenic medication proved to be effective for the patient.
meanings.sent2: The allogenic vaccine provided immunity against the virus.
meanings.sent3: Using allogenic ingredients, the chef created a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The allogenic material used in construction enhanced the building's durability.
meanings.sent5: The allogenic scent of the perfume transported her to a different place.
